models.name: discussion_board_system_settings
models.description: Central configuration repository for platform-wide system settings and configuration parameters. Stores system operation parameters including feature flags, email configuration, rate limiting thresholds, moderation settings, and performance parameters. Acts as the single source of truth for how the platform operates at the system level. Settings can be simple key-value pairs or complex structured JSON configurations. Modified infrequently but read frequently by multiple system components.

plainFields.name: setting_key
plainFields.description: Unique identifier key for the configuration setting (e.g., 'email_sender_address', 'max_discussions_per_day', 'moderation_response_time_minutes'). Used to retrieve specific settings. Must be unique across all settings to prevent duplicate configurations.

plainFields.name: setting_value
plainFields.description: The actual configuration value stored as string (converted to appropriate type by application). Can store simple values (numbers, strings) or complex JSON structures. Empty string or null indicates setting is disabled or unconfigured.

plainFields.name: setting_type
plainFields.description: Data type of the setting value to guide interpretation: 'string', 'integer', 'boolean', 'json', 'uri'. Helps application layer deserialize and validate the setting_value appropriately.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Human-readable description explaining what this setting controls, valid value ranges, and any dependencies on other settings. Helps administrators understand the purpose and impact of each configuration parameter.

plainFields.name: category
plainFields.description: Logical grouping category for organizing settings in UI and configuration panels: 'email', 'rate_limiting', 'moderation', 'performance', 'features', 'security'. Enables administrators to view related settings together.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this setting is currently active and should be applied by the system. Allows disabling settings without deletion for audit trail purposes.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this setting was first created, recorded in UTC. Establishes when the configuration was initially added to the system.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the most recent update to this setting's value or properties. Updated whenever the setting is modified to track change history.

models.name: discussion_board_categories
models.description: Defines the taxonomy of discussion categories that organize all discussions on the platform. Contains category metadata including name, description, display order, and visibility. Supports hierarchical category structure through optional parent_category_id for subcategories. Categories are the primary organizational structure that discussions are assigned to. Referenced by discussion management and moderation systems. Includes category-specific rules/guidelines and statistics about category activity.

foreignFields.name: parent_category_id
foreignFields.description: Self-referencing foreign key to parent category for hierarchical category structure. Enables subcategories under main categories. Null if this is a top-level category with no parent. Example: 'International Trade' might have parent_category_id pointing to 'Economics' category.

plainFields.name: category_name
plainFields.description: Human-readable name of the category displayed in the UI (e.g., 'Economics', 'Political Systems', 'International Trade'). Limited to 50 characters for display formatting. Must be unique to prevent duplicate categories with same name.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Detailed description of the category purpose and scope, explaining what topics belong in this category. Displayed to users when browsing categories. Helps users understand appropriate content for each category and what discussions to expect.

plainFields.name: display_order
plainFields.description: Numeric order for displaying categories in UI listings. Lower numbers appear first. Used for sorting categories in navigation menus and category lists. Administrators can reorder by adjusting this value.

plainFields.name: icon_url
plainFields.description: URL to optional icon/image representing the category visually in UI. Used in category badges, navigation, and listings. Supports visual identification of categories at a glance.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this category is currently active and accepting new discussions. Allows archiving categories without deletion. When false, prevents creation of new discussions in this category but keeps existing discussions visible in read-only mode.

plainFields.name: is_visible
plainFields.description: Whether this category is visible to non-administrator users. False hides category from category browser and discussion listings. Used for staging categories before public launch or hiding deprecated categories.

plainFields.name: category_rules
plainFields.description: Category-specific guidelines or rules in addition to general community guidelines. Stored as JSON for structured enforcement. Example: category-specific prohibited topics or content restrictions unique to that category.

plainFields.name: discussion_count
plainFields.description: Cached count of active discussions in this category for performance optimization. Incremented when discussion created, decremented when deleted. Recalculated periodically from actual database records to maintain accuracy.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this category was created in the system, recorded in UTC. Establishes when the category was added to the platform.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent modification to category properties. Updated when category metadata changes (name, description, rules, etc.).

models.name: discussion_board_community_guidelines
models.description: Versioned repository of community guidelines and policy documents governing user behavior and content standards. Maintains complete history of all guideline versions with effective dates and version numbers. Tracks when guidelines were created, updated, and became effective. Provides audit trail for compliance purposes and historical context for moderation decisions. Each version is a complete snapshot of guidelines at a point in time, allowing reference to guidelines that applied when a moderation decision was made.

plainFields.name: version_number
plainFields.description: Sequential version number of the guidelines document (1, 2, 3, etc.). Used to identify which version of guidelines was active at any given time. Incremented each time guidelines are updated.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Title of the guidelines document version (e.g., 'Community Guidelines v2.1' or 'Community Guidelines v3.0'). Displayed in audit logs and version history.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Complete text content of the community guidelines document. Includes all rules, policies, prohibited content types, and enforcement procedures. Stored as plain text or markdown for easy reading and versioning.

plainFields.name: effective_date
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this version of guidelines became effective and should be applied. Can be in the future for pre-scheduled guideline updates. Used to determine which guidelines applied at time of user action for moderation decisions.

plainFields.name: is_current
plainFields.description: Whether this is the current active version of guidelines. Only one version should have is_current=true. Used for quick lookup of current guidelines without querying by date.

plainFields.name: created_by
plainFields.description: Username or ID of administrator who created this guidelines version. Recorded for audit trail and accountability. Identifies who was responsible for policy changes.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this guidelines version was created/stored in the database, recorded in UTC. Different from effective_date which indicates when guidelines take effect.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last modification to this guidelines version record. Generally not updated after creation (guidelines are versioned, not modified), but included for consistency.

models.name: discussion_board_users
models.description: Core user account entity representing all system participants (guests, members, moderators, administrators). Stores essential user identity information including email, username, account status, and role assignment. This is the primary entity that all other user-related tables reference. The separation of user account from authentication credentials allows flexible credential management and future support for multi-factor authentication. Users can have one or more roles through the user_roles junction table, enabling complex permission hierarchies.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: User's verified email address, used for authentication login and communication. Must be unique across the system. Email verification is required before account becomes active and can participate in discussions.

plainFields.name: username
plainFields.description: Unique username for public display and @mentions. Must be 3-20 characters, alphanumeric with underscore allowed. Username is read-only after account creation to prevent confusion in discussions and mentions.

plainFields.name: account_status
plainFields.description: Current account status: 'pending_verification' (email not verified), 'active' (normal state), 'suspended' (temporary suspension), 'banned' (permanent ban), 'deleted' (user-requested deletion, anonymized). Controls whether user can access platform and create content.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Whether the user's email address has been verified. Unverified accounts can view but cannot create discussions, post comments, or vote. Verified during registration through email link.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when user account was created. Server time (UTC). Used for tracking account age and applying new-account restrictions.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last account modification (status change, profile update, etc.). Server time (UTC). Updated by system on any material change to account.

plainFields.name: last_login_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of user's most recent successful login. Server time (UTC). NULL if user has never logged in. Used to detect inactive accounts and suspicious access patterns.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of user's most recent activity on the platform (post, comment, vote, page view, etc.). Server time (UTC). Used to track engagement and detect dormant accounts for optional cleanup.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when user requested account deletion. Server time (UTC). NULL if account is not deleted. Set to deletion timestamp when user completes deletion process. Marks soft-deletion boundary.

models.name: discussion_board_user_roles
models.description: Role assignment mapping table implementing role-based access control (RBAC). Each user can be assigned multiple roles (member, moderator of multiple categories, administrator). Tracks when roles are assigned and by whom for audit compliance. Roles determine permissions for creating discussions, moderating content, and administrative functions. This junction table allows flexible role assignments without modifying the user table.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the user being assigned a role. {@link discussion_board_users.id}. Foreign key relationship ensures role assignments only exist for valid users.

plainFields.name: role
plainFields.description: Role identifier: 'guest' (unauthenticated, read-only), 'member' (full participation), 'moderator' (content moderation), 'administrator' (full system access). Determines permission level for API operations.

plainFields.name: scope
plainFields.description: Optional scope for scoped roles. For moderator role, contains category_id(s) that moderator has authority over. NULL for non-scoped roles (member, guest, administrator). Allows granular permission assignment at category level.

plainFields.name: assigned_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when role was assigned to user. Server time (UTC). Used to track role change history and audit trail.

plainFields.name: assigned_by
plainFields.description: User ID of administrator who assigned this role. NULL for initial member role automatically assigned at registration. Tracks who made permission changes for audit purposes.

plainFields.name: revoked_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when role was revoked/removed from user. Server time (UTC). NULL if role is currently active. Soft deletion allows history tracking of role changes.

plainFields.name: revoked_by
plainFields.description: User ID of administrator who revoked this role. NULL if role is still active or was auto-assigned. Tracks who removed permissions for compliance.

models.name: discussion_board_authentication
models.description: User authentication credentials storage, separated from user account table for security and flexibility. Contains password hashes (never plaintext passwords), password change history for preventing reuse, email verification tokens, and password reset tokens. Separation from user table allows future support of multi-factor authentication and alternative authentication methods without schema changes. Password hashes use bcrypt with cost factor 12+.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to user account these credentials belong to. {@link discussion_board_users.id}. One-to-one relationship: each user has exactly one authentication record.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Bcrypt-hashed password (cost factor 12+). NEVER plaintext password. Generated using bcrypt algorithm with unique salt. Updated when user changes password or administrator resets password.

plainFields.name: email_verification_token
plainFields.description: Unique cryptographically random token for email verification during registration. 32+ bytes, base64-encoded. NULL if email is already verified. Expires 24 hours after generation. Single-use, invalidated upon verification.

plainFields.name: email_verification_token_expires_at
plainFields.description: Expiration timestamp for email verification token. Server time (UTC). NULL if email verified or no pending verification. Tokens expire 24 hours after generation.

plainFields.name: password_reset_token
plainFields.description: Unique token for password reset process. Generated when user requests 'forgot password'. 32+ bytes, base64-encoded. NULL if no reset in progress. Single-use, invalidated after one password reset.

plainFields.name: password_reset_token_expires_at
plainFields.description: Expiration timestamp for password reset token. Server time (UTC). NULL if no reset in progress. Tokens expire 1 hour after generation to limit reset window.

plainFields.name: failed_login_attempts
plainFields.description: Count of consecutive failed login attempts for this user. Resets to 0 on successful login. Used to implement brute-force attack protection. Incremented on each failed password attempt.

plainFields.name: locked_until
plainFields.description: Timestamp when account lock expires (if temporarily locked due to too many failed logins). Server time (UTC). NULL if account is not locked. Account auto-unlocks at this time, allowing login retry.

plainFields.name: password_last_changed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent password change or initial password set at registration. Server time (UTC). Used for forced password change policies and detecting stale credentials.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when authentication record was created (same as user registration). Server time (UTC).

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last modification to this authentication record (password change, token generation, etc.). Server time (UTC).

models.name: discussion_board_sessions
models.description: Active user session tracking for multi-session management, security monitoring, and session termination. Records JWT token information, device details, geographic location, and session lifecycle events. Enables detection of suspicious activity (impossible travel, unusual devices), concurrent session limits, and remote logout capabilities. Sessions are terminated when tokens expire, user logs out, or administrator action is taken.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to authenticated user owning this session. {@link discussion_board_users.id}. A user can have multiple concurrent active sessions (up to 5), each tracked separately.

plainFields.name: session_token
plainFields.description: JWT access token value for this session. Used to authenticate API requests. Expires 15 minutes after session creation. Derived from JWT but stored for session lookup and revocation.

plainFields.name: refresh_token
plainFields.description: JWT refresh token for obtaining new access tokens without re-authentication. Expires 7 days after session creation. Single-use: invalidated when used to generate new access token.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address of client making the login request. Used for security monitoring, brute-force detection, and geographic location lookup. Recorded at session creation.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: User agent string from HTTP request (browser type, OS, version). Parsed to identify device type (mobile, tablet, desktop). Used to detect unusual login patterns and display active sessions list.

plainFields.name: device_name
plainFields.description: Human-readable device name derived from user agent. Examples: 'Chrome on Windows', 'Safari on iOS'. Displayed to user when reviewing active sessions.

plainFields.name: geographic_location
plainFields.description: Geographic location (city, country) determined from IP address via GeoIP lookup. Displayed to user and used to detect impossible travel patterns and geographic anomalies.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when session was created (user logged in). Server time (UTC). Used to calculate session age and auto-expiration.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent API request from this session. Server time (UTC). Initially set to created_at. Updated on each request to track session activity.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when session/refresh token expires and session becomes invalid. Server time (UTC). Set to 7 days after created_at. Refresh tokens cannot be used after this time.

plainFields.name: terminated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when session was manually terminated (user logout, password change, admin action, etc.). Server time (UTC). NULL if session is still active. After termination, session cannot be used for authentication.

plainFields.name: is_active
plainFields.description: Whether this session is currently active (true) or has been terminated/expired (false). Redundant with terminated_at but provides efficient query filtering. Set to false on termination.

models.name: discussion_board_user_profiles
models.description: User profile information including display name, bio, avatar, and public profile data. Separate from authentication credentials to support profile deletion and GDPR compliance while preserving account history for audit purposes.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the user account. {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: display_name
plainFields.description: User's display name visible in discussions and comments. Maximum 50 characters. Can differ from username for personalization.

plainFields.name: bio
plainFields.description: User's biographical information and interests. Maximum 500 characters. Optional field for profile customization.

plainFields.name: avatar_url
plainFields.description: URL to user's profile avatar image. Stored in external CDN/object storage service.

plainFields.name: avatar_thumbnail_url
plainFields.description: URL to user's profile avatar thumbnail (150x150px). Stored in external CDN/object storage service.

plainFields.name: website_url
plainFields.description: Optional URL to user's personal website or blog. Validated as valid URL format starting with http:// or https://.

plainFields.name: location
plainFields.description: User's location information as free-form text. Maximum 100 characters. Not geocoded, user-entered only.

plainFields.name: interests
plainFields.description: User's areas of interest in comma-separated format. Used for personalization and discovery. Maximum 500 characters.

plainFields.name: profile_visibility
plainFields.description: Profile visibility setting: 'public' (visible to all), 'members_only' (visible to authenticated members), or 'private' (hidden from other users). Defaults to 'public'.

plainFields.name: show_online_status
plainFields.description: Whether user's online/offline status is visible to other members. Defaults to true for transparency.

plainFields.name: show_activity_history
plainFields.description: Whether user's discussion and comment history is visible on their public profile. Defaults to true for contribution transparency.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when profile was created, typically at account registration time.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last profile update, tracking when bio, avatar, or other profile fields changed.

models.name: discussion_board_user_preferences
models.description: User preferences and settings for customizing their experience on the platform including notification frequency, theme preferences, and display preferences. Allows users to personalize their interactions.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the user account. {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: theme_preference
plainFields.description: User's preferred color theme: 'light', 'dark', or 'auto' (follows system preference). Defaults to 'auto'.

plainFields.name: items_per_page
plainFields.description: Number of discussions or comments to display per page in pagination. Valid range: 10-100. Defaults to 20.

plainFields.name: sort_preference
plainFields.description: Default sorting preference for discussions: 'newest', 'most_active', 'most_voted', or 'trending'. Defaults to 'newest'.

plainFields.name: reply_sort_preference
plainFields.description: Default sorting preference for comments/replies: 'oldest' (chronological), 'newest', or 'most_voted'. Defaults to 'oldest'.

plainFields.name: language_preference
plainFields.description: User's preferred language code (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr'). Defaults to 'en'. Used for UI localization.

plainFields.name: timezone
plainFields.description: User's timezone (IANA timezone identifier, e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London'). Used for displaying timestamps in user's local time.

plainFields.name: compact_mode_enabled
plainFields.description: Whether to use compact layout for discussions and comments, displaying more items per screen. Defaults to false.

plainFields.name: show_avatars
plainFields.description: Whether to display user avatars in discussions and comments. Defaults to true. Users can disable for bandwidth/performance.

plainFields.name: enable_keyboard_shortcuts
plainFields.description: Whether keyboard shortcuts are enabled for navigation and common actions. Defaults to false for accessibility.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when user preferences were initialized, typically at account creation.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last preference update when user modified any preference setting.

models.name: discussion_board_user_notification_settings
models.description: Granular notification preferences for users controlling what notifications they receive and through which channels. Enables GDPR-compliant consent management for email and in-app notifications.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the user account. {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: email_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Global toggle for all email notifications. When disabled, no emails are sent regardless of specific settings. Defaults to true.

plainFields.name: in_app_notifications_enabled
plainFields.description: Global toggle for in-app notifications shown in the notification center. Defaults to true.

plainFields.name: email_frequency
plainFields.description: Email notification frequency: 'immediate' (one email per event), 'daily_digest', 'weekly_digest', or 'never'. Defaults to 'immediate'.

plainFields.name: notify_on_reply
plainFields.description: Whether to notify when someone replies to user's comments or discussions. Defaults to true. Major engagement driver.

plainFields.name: notify_on_upvote
plainFields.description: Whether to notify when user's posts receive upvotes. Defaults to false to reduce notification volume.

plainFields.name: notify_on_mention
plainFields.description: Whether to notify when user is mentioned (@username) in discussions or comments. Defaults to true.

plainFields.name: notify_on_moderation_action
plainFields.description: Whether to notify when moderator takes action on user's content (removal, warning, etc.). Defaults to true. Important for user awareness.

plainFields.name: notify_on_discussion_closed
plainFields.description: Whether to notify when a discussion the user created is closed by moderators. Defaults to true.

plainFields.name: notify_on_announcement
plainFields.description: Whether to receive important platform announcements and system notifications. Defaults to true.

plainFields.name: notify_on_weekly_summary
plainFields.description: Whether to receive optional weekly summary emails with top discussions and activity. Defaults to false.

plainFields.name: unsubscribe_token
plainFields.description: Unique token used in email unsubscribe links for one-click unsubscription. Regenerated if user re-subscribes.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when notification settings were initialized, typically at account creation.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last notification setting change tracking user consent changes.

models.name: discussion_board_discussions
models.description: Core discussion topics/threads that form the main conversational containers. Users create discussions within categories to start conversations. Each discussion contains metadata about engagement, moderation status, and lifecycle (active, closed, archived, hidden). This table is the primary reference point for all discussion-related queries and serves as the anchor for comments, votes, flags, and moderation actions.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_category_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the category this discussion belongs to. {@link discussion_board_categories.id}. Each discussion must be in exactly one category for logical organization.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the user who created this discussion. {@link discussion_board_users.id}. Tracks original author for attribution and permissions.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Discussion topic title/heading displayed in discussion lists. 5-200 characters. Searchable field for discoverability. Clear, descriptive titles help users understand discussion topic at a glance.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Main discussion content/body text containing the discussion starter's message. 20-5000 characters. Searchable full-text field. Can be edited by creator within 24 hours or by moderators anytime.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Discussion lifecycle status. Values: 'active' (open for comments), 'closed' (no new comments allowed), 'archived' (moved to archive), 'hidden' (removed from public view due to violations). Controls what actions users can take on the discussion.

plainFields.name: view_count
plainFields.description: Total number of times this discussion has been viewed/opened. Used for engagement metrics and trending calculations. Incremented each time someone opens the discussion.

plainFields.name: comment_count
plainFields.description: Denormalized count of comments/replies on this discussion. Provides fast access for UI without requiring aggregate query. Must be kept in sync with actual comment count through triggers or application logic.

plainFields.name: vote_count
plainFields.description: Net vote count (upvotes minus downvotes) on this discussion. Positive value indicates more upvotes, negative indicates more downvotes. Used for ranking discussions by popularity.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the most recent comment or reply in this discussion. Used to identify active discussions and sort by 'most active' queries. Updates whenever new comment is posted.

plainFields.name: is_pinned
plainFields.description: Whether this discussion is pinned to top of its category by moderator. Pinned discussions display above unpinned discussions in category browsing. Used for highlighting important or exemplary discussions.

plainFields.name: is_locked
plainFields.description: Whether new comments are prevented on this discussion. Locked discussions remain visible but prevent further participation. Used by moderators to close discussions while preserving content.

plainFields.name: edit_count
plainFields.description: Number of times the discussion description has been edited by creator or moderators. Incremented each time edit is saved. Audit trail indicator showing if content has been modified.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when discussion was created. Server time (UTC). Immutable; set at creation and never changed. Used for sorting discussions chronologically.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when discussion was last modified (content edited, status changed, etc.). Server time (UTC). Updated whenever discussion record is modified. Shows freshness of discussion.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when discussion was soft-deleted. NULL if discussion is active. When set, discussion is archived/hidden from normal queries but preserved in database for recovery/audit. Enables 'undo delete' functionality.

models.name: discussion_board_discussion_metadata
models.description: Extended metadata and analytics for discussions, supporting the snapshot pattern for historical tracking. Stores analytics data, engagement metrics, and metadata separate from main discussion table to keep core table lean and performant. Maintains 1:1 relationship with discussion_board_discussions. Contains immutable snapshots of engagement at creation time, engagement scores, and moderation metrics for trend analysis and performance optimization.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the discussion this metadata describes. {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}. One-to-one relationship: each discussion has exactly one metadata record. Unique constraint enforces 1:1 cardinality.

plainFields.name: initial_comment_count
plainFields.description: Immutable snapshot of comment count at time discussion was created (always 0). Preserved for historical comparison to show how discussion engagement grew over time.

plainFields.name: initial_vote_count
plainFields.description: Immutable snapshot of vote count at time discussion was created (always 0). Preserved for historical comparison to track vote acquisition patterns.

plainFields.name: peak_engagement_date
plainFields.description: Date/time when this discussion reached its peak daily activity/engagement (most comments or votes in a single day). NULL if no peak has been recorded yet. Used to identify when discussion was most active.

plainFields.name: engagement_score
plainFields.description: Calculated composite engagement metric combining comments and votes: (comment_count * 1.0) + (vote_count * 0.5). Used for ranking discussions by overall engagement without sorting by single metric.

plainFields.name: average_comment_length
plainFields.description: Average character length of comments in this discussion. Calculated as: total_characters_in_comments / comment_count. Indicates discussion depth/thoughtfulness (longer comments often indicate more substantive debate).

plainFields.name: unique_participant_count
plainFields.description: Number of unique users who have participated in this discussion (created comments). Does not include discussion creator if they haven't replied. Shows discussion breadth/inclusiveness.

plainFields.name: moderator_review_count
plainFields.description: Number of times this discussion has been reviewed by moderators (flagged and review completed). Indicates discussion was reviewed for policy violations. Higher count suggests moderator attention to this discussion.

plainFields.name: flag_count
plainFields.description: Total number of times content in this discussion (discussion or comments) has been flagged/reported by users. Indicates community concern about discussion quality or appropriateness.

plainFields.name: closure_reason
plainFields.description: Reason why discussion was closed or archived, if applicable. NULL if discussion still active. Examples: 'duplicate', 'off-topic', 'resolved', 'policy-violation', 'spam'. Explains to users why discussion was closed.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when metadata record was created (same as parent discussion creation). Server time (UTC). Immutable; set once at creation.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when metadata was last updated (engagement metrics recalculated, flags updated, etc.). Server time (UTC). Updated whenever metadata values change (metrics updated, closure reason set, etc.).

models.name: discussion_board_comments
models.description: Individual comments and nested replies posted to discussions. Represents the actual conversational content with full edit history and soft delete support. Supports threaded conversations up to 5 levels deep. Core high-volume table in the system.

foreignFields.name: discussion_id
foreignFields.description: Reference to the parent discussion. {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Author of the comment. {@link discussion_board_users.id}

foreignFields.name: parent_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Parent comment for nested replies. Null for top-level comments. {@link discussion_board_comments.id}

plainFields.name: comment_text
plainFields.description: Full text content of the comment. Stored plain text with HTML escaping applied by application layer. Range: 1-2000 characters.

plainFields.name: nesting_depth
plainFields.description: How many levels deep this comment is nested (1 for root level, 2 for reply to root, etc.). Maximum 5 levels enforced by application and database check constraint.

plainFields.name: vote_count
plainFields.description: Cached vote count (upvotes minus downvotes). Denormalized for query performance, recalculated nightly from votes table. Updated asynchronously.

plainFields.name: reply_count
plainFields.description: Number of direct replies to this comment. Used for determining if comment can be deleted and for reply preview functionality.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of comment: 'active' (normal), 'flagged' (awaiting review), 'removed' (moderation action), 'edited' (content modified). Default 'active'.

plainFields.name: is_edited
plainFields.description: Whether the comment has been edited since creation. Used to display '[edited X minutes ago]' indicator to users.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when comment was created. Server time, UTC, seconds precision. Used for sorting and activity tracking.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last update to comment (including edits and status changes). Server time, UTC, seconds precision.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when comment was soft-deleted. Null if comment is active. Supports 90-day recovery window and compliance.

models.name: discussion_board_comment_threads
models.description: Organizes comments into conversation threads. Represents the hierarchical structure of nested replies. Automatically managed through comment creation/deletion. Tracks thread-level metadata for efficient querying of threaded conversations.

foreignFields.name: discussion_id
foreignFields.description: The discussion this thread belongs to. {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}

foreignFields.name: root_comment_id
foreignFields.description: The root/top-level comment that started this thread. {@link discussion_board_comments.id}

foreignFields.name: parent_comment_id
foreignFields.description: The parent comment if this is a nested thread. Null for root-level threads. {@link discussion_board_comments.id}

plainFields.name: total_replies
plainFields.description: Total number of replies in this entire thread (all nested levels). Used for pagination and thread size estimation.

plainFields.name: unique_participants
plainFields.description: Number of unique users who have participated in this thread. Used for engagement metrics and thread popularity indicators.

plainFields.name: last_activity_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent comment in thread. Used for sorting 'most active' threads and real-time activity tracking.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when thread was created (same as root comment creation). Server time, UTC, seconds precision.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of last update to thread metadata. Updated when replies added or thread marked as resolved.

models.name: discussion_board_content_edits
models.description: Immutable audit trail of all comment edits. Append-only table tracking every modification to comment content. Supports transparency, appeals, and compliance requirements. Used for displaying edit history and detecting coordinated manipulation.

foreignFields.name: comment_id
foreignFields.description: The comment that was edited. {@link discussion_board_comments.id}

foreignFields.name: editor_user_id
foreignFields.description: User who made the edit. {@link discussion_board_users.id}

plainFields.name: original_content
plainFields.description: Full text of comment before this edit. Preserved for historical record and appeals. Maximum 2000 characters.

plainFields.name: edited_content
plainFields.description: Full text of comment after this edit. Shows what user changed to. Maximum 2000 characters.

plainFields.name: edit_reason
plainFields.description: Reason for edit if provided by moderator (e.g., 'Removed slur', 'Redacted personal info'). Member edits typically empty. Maximum 500 characters.

plainFields.name: is_visible_to_user
plainFields.description: Whether edit history is visible to general users. True by default. Moderators can hide sensitive edits from public view.

plainFields.name: edit_type
plainFields.description: Type of edit: 'member_edit' (user edited own comment), 'moderator_edit' (moderator edited for violation), 'system_edit' (automated system change). Used for audit filtering.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when edit was made. Server time, UTC, seconds precision. Used for chronological edit history.

models.name: discussion_board_votes
models.description: Records individual votes (upvotes/downvotes) cast by members on discussions and comments. Enables voting feature and tracks user engagement. Relationship with {@link discussion_board_users.id} and either {@link discussion_board_discussions.id} or {@link discussion_board_comments.id}. Vote counts are calculated from this data for content ranking and engagement metrics.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: Member who cast the vote. Reference to {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: Discussion being voted on (nullable if comment is being voted). Reference to {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Comment being voted on (nullable if discussion is being voted). Reference to {@link discussion_board_comments.id}.

plainFields.name: vote_direction
plainFields.description: Direction of the vote: 'upvote' or 'downvote'. Determines whether vote contributes +1 or -1 to content score.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when vote was cast (server time, UTC). Used for vote history and trend analysis.

models.name: discussion_board_vote_history
models.description: Complete historical record of all vote changes for audit trail and analytics. Tracks original votes, vote changes (upvote to downvote or removal), and provides immutable history of voting activity. Enables analysis of vote patterns and verification of vote counts. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}, {@link discussion_board_votes.id}, and either {@link discussion_board_discussions.id} or {@link discussion_board_comments.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: Member who performed the vote action. Reference to {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_vote_id
foreignFields.description: Vote record that this history entry documents. Reference to {@link discussion_board_votes.id}. Null if vote was removed/deleted.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: Discussion that was voted on (nullable if comment). Reference to {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Comment that was voted on (nullable if discussion). Reference to {@link discussion_board_comments.id}.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of voting action: 'vote_cast' (new vote), 'vote_changed' (upvote to downvote or vice versa), 'vote_removed' (vote deleted). Enables understanding vote change history.

plainFields.name: previous_vote_direction
plainFields.description: Previous vote direction if this is a vote change. Null for new votes or vote removals. Helps reconstruct vote history.

plainFields.name: new_vote_direction
plainFields.description: New vote direction after this action. Null if vote was removed. Captures the result of the voting action.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which vote was cast. Enables fraud detection and abuse prevention analysis.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser/device information from voting request. Used for device tracking and anomaly detection.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of vote action (server time, UTC). Records when action occurred for complete audit trail.

models.name: discussion_board_bookmarks
models.description: Tracks discussions and comments that members have bookmarked/saved for later reference. Enables users to maintain personal collection of important or interesting content. Relationship with {@link discussion_board_users.id} and either {@link discussion_board_discussions.id} or {@link discussion_board_comments.id}. One bookmark per user per content item.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: Member who bookmarked the content. Reference to {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: Discussion being bookmarked (nullable if comment is bookmarked). Reference to {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_comment_id
foreignFields.description: Comment being bookmarked (nullable if discussion is bookmarked). Reference to {@link discussion_board_comments.id}.

plainFields.name: notes
plainFields.description: Optional personal notes attached to bookmark. User can add custom notes explaining why they bookmarked this content (maximum 500 characters).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when bookmark was created (server time, UTC). Enables sorting bookmarks by date.

models.name: discussion_board_follows
models.description: Tracks discussions that members are following for activity notifications. When following a discussion, member receives notifications when new comments are posted. Enables community members to track interesting conversations. Relationship with {@link discussion_board_users.id} and {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}. One follow record per user per discussion.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: Member who is following the discussion. Reference to {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_discussion_id
foreignFields.description: Discussion being followed. Reference to {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}.

plainFields.name: notification_preference
plainFields.description: How follower wants to be notified: 'immediate' (instant notification per comment), 'daily_digest' (daily summary), 'weekly_digest' (weekly summary). Controls notification frequency.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when follow relationship was created (server time, UTC).

models.name: discussion_board_user_reputation
models.description: Aggregate user reputation/karma scores calculated from voting activity and moderation actions. Tracks member's standing in community based on quality of contributions. Scores increment with upvotes received and positive community feedback, decrement with downvotes and violations. Used for member ranking, trending algorithms, and moderator identification. Relationship with {@link discussion_board_users.id}. One record per user.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: User whose reputation is being tracked. Reference to {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: total_reputation_score
plainFields.description: Aggregate reputation score (karma) for the user. Calculated as sum of: upvotes received on discussions (+10 per upvote) + upvotes on comments (+2 per upvote) - downvotes on discussions (-5 per downvote) - downvotes on comments (-1 per downvote) + bonuses for moderation, minus penalties for violations.

plainFields.name: total_upvotes_received
plainFields.description: Total count of upvotes received on all user's discussions and comments combined. Used for trending and user ranking.

plainFields.name: total_downvotes_received
plainFields.description: Total count of downvotes received on all user's discussions and comments combined. Indicator of content quality and community feedback.

plainFields.name: discussion_upvotes_received
plainFields.description: Count of upvotes specifically on discussions authored by user. Weighted more heavily in reputation calculation than comment upvotes.

plainFields.name: comment_upvotes_received
plainFields.description: Count of upvotes specifically on comments authored by user.

plainFields.name: moderation_bonus
plainFields.description: Reputation bonus for moderation activities if user is a moderator (+1 per flag resolved, +5 per warning issued, +10 per suspension executed). Recognizes community service.

plainFields.name: violation_penalty
plainFields.description: Reputation penalty for guideline violations (-5 per warning, -25 per suspension, -100 per permanent ban). Reflects community standing.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent reputation update (server time, UTC). When reputation scores were last calculated.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when reputation record was created for user (server time, UTC). Usually same as user account creation.

models.name: discussion_board_content_flags
models.description: Records user-submitted reports of inappropriate content. Captures what content was flagged, by whom, for what reason, and tracking the status of the report through the moderation workflow. Essential for the content moderation system, enabling the community to report violations and moderators to manage review queue.

foreignFields.name: reported_by_user_id
foreignFields.description: User who submitted the report. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_id
foreignFields.description: Discussion that was flagged, if applicable. References {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}.

foreignFields.name: comment_id
foreignFields.description: Comment that was flagged, if applicable. References {@link discussion_board_comments.id}.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User who created the flagged content. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: violation_category
plainFields.description: Category of violation reported: Violence, Harassment, Misinformation, Spam, Illegal, PlatformAbuse, Other. Helps moderators categorize and prioritize reports.

plainFields.name: reporter_explanation
plainFields.description: User's detailed explanation of why content violates guidelines (maximum 500 characters). Provides context for moderator review.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of flag report: pending (awaiting review), under_review (moderator actively reviewing), resolved (decision made). Used for workflow state tracking.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when flag was submitted. Used for sorting reports in queue.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of most recent status update. Tracks progress through review workflow.

models.name: discussion_board_flag_reviews
models.description: Records when moderators begin reviewing flagged content. Tracks which moderator is assigned to review each flag, when they start, and ensures different moderators review appeals (conflict of interest prevention). Bridges user reports and moderation decisions.

foreignFields.name: flag_id
foreignFields.description: Content flag being reviewed. References {@link discussion_board_content_flags.id}.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator assigned to review this flag. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: review_started_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when moderator began reviewing this flag. Tracks response time to reports.

plainFields.name: review_notes
plainFields.description: Internal notes from moderator during review process, documenting analysis and reasoning (maximum 1000 characters).

models.name: discussion_board_moderation_actions
models.description: Core record of all moderator enforcement actions. Captures what action was taken (remove content, warn user, suspend account, ban), why it was taken, who took it, and when. The central decision log for the moderation system, enabling transparency and audit trails.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator or administrator who took this action. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User who is subject of this action (usually the violator). References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: discussion_id
foreignFields.description: Discussion affected by this action, if applicable. References {@link discussion_board_discussions.id}.

foreignFields.name: comment_id
foreignFields.description: Comment affected by this action, if applicable. References {@link discussion_board_comments.id}.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of enforcement action taken: remove (content deleted), edit (content modified), warn (warning issued), suspend (temporary ban), ban (permanent ban), label (content flagged as disputed). Determines which escalation table is relevant.

plainFields.name: violation_reason
plainFields.description: Specific guideline violated and brief explanation why action was taken (maximum 500 characters). Justification for the moderation decision.

plainFields.name: action_details
plainFields.description: Additional details about the action taken, such as duration for suspensions, specific edits made, or context (maximum 1000 characters).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when moderation action was taken. Record creation timestamp for audit trail.

models.name: discussion_board_user_warnings
models.description: Records formal warnings issued to users for guideline violations. Each warning is immutable and tracks escalation (counting toward automatic suspension). Supports the progressive penalty framework by maintaining warning history and count for each user.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User who received this warning. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator who issued this warning. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: Associated moderation action record. References {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}.

plainFields.name: violation_reason
plainFields.description: Description of the violation that triggered this warning (maximum 500 characters). Explains to user why warning was issued.

plainFields.name: warning_count_at_time
plainFields.description: This user's warning count when warning was issued (1st, 2nd, 3rd warning, etc.). Used to determine if automatic escalation to suspension should occur.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when warning was issued. First warning, second warning, etc. timestamps determine escalation logic.

models.name: discussion_board_user_suspensions
models.description: Records temporary restrictions on user accounts. Tracks suspension start and end dates, enabling automatic expiration and re-enabling of accounts. Part of progressive enforcement: escalated from warnings for repeated violations or serious first offenses.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User whose account is suspended. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator who issued the suspension. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: Associated moderation action record. References {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Reason for suspension explaining which guideline(s) were violated (maximum 500 characters). Justification visible to user.

plainFields.name: suspension_start_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when suspension became effective. User cannot post after this time.

plainFields.name: suspension_end_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when suspension expires and account becomes active again. Used for automatic account re-enablement.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when suspension was issued by moderator. Record creation time for audit trail.

models.name: discussion_board_user_bans
models.description: Records permanent bans of user accounts. Final enforcement action in progressive penalty system (only for critical violations or repeated serious violations). Immutable record supporting ban appeals and historical tracking of banned users.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User who is permanently banned. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Administrator or moderator who issued the ban. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: Associated moderation action record. References {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Detailed reason for permanent ban, citing critical violations or repeated serious breaches (maximum 500 characters). Justification for permanent account termination.

plainFields.name: ban_type
plainFields.description: Type of ban: critical_violation (immediate permanent ban for CSAM, violence, threats), escalated (from repeated suspensions), emergency (security threat). Distinguishes ban severity levels.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when ban was issued. Immutable record creation time.

models.name: discussion_board_appeals
models.description: Records user appeals against moderation decisions (warnings, suspensions, bans). Tracks appeal submission, review status, and outcome. Supports appeal workflow: submitted  under_review  approved/denied, enabling fair dispute resolution.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User who submitted the appeal. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description: The moderation decision being appealed. References {@link discussion_board_moderation_actions.id}.

foreignFields.name: reviewed_by_moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator who reviewed the appeal (must be different from original decision-maker for fairness). References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: appeal_reason
plainFields.description: User's explanation of why they believe the moderation decision was unjust (maximum 2000 characters). Detailed justification for the appeal.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of appeal: submitted (pending review), under_review (moderator actively considering), approved (decision reversed), denied (decision upheld), partially_approved (penalty reduced). Workflow state indicator.

plainFields.name: appeal_decision
plainFields.description: Decision made on appeal: approved (original decision reversed, content restored, action cancelled), denied (original decision upheld, penalty continues), partially_approved (penalty reduced, e.g., 7-day suspension reduced to 24-hour). Outcome of appeal review.

plainFields.name: appeal_reasoning
plainFields.description: Detailed reasoning from moderator reviewing the appeal, explaining why decision was approved/denied/partially_approved (maximum 1000 characters). Transparency for appeal outcome.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when appeal was submitted by user. Start of appeal review period.

plainFields.name: reviewed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when appeal review was completed and decision made. Null until appeal is decided.

models.name: discussion_board_moderation_logs
models.description: Comprehensive audit trail of all moderation system events. Immutable log capturing every moderator action, system event, and relevant decision for compliance, investigation, and performance monitoring. Central record for forensic analysis and accountability.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator performing the action. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User affected by this log event. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Type of moderation event logged: flag_submitted, flag_reviewed, content_removed, content_edited, warning_issued, user_suspended, user_banned, appeal_submitted, appeal_reviewed, moderator_assigned, report_dismissed. Categorizes log events.

plainFields.name: event_description
plainFields.description: Detailed description of the event that occurred (maximum 1000 characters). Human-readable account of what happened.

plainFields.name: event_details
plainFields.description: Structured additional context about the event, including affected content IDs, action parameters, or system state (maximum 2000 characters). JSON or key-value format acceptable.

plainFields.name: severity
plainFields.description: Severity level of this event: critical (CSAM, violence, threats), high (bans, escalated violations), medium (warnings, suspensions, appeals), low (routine moderation notes). Used for alert and filtering.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this log event was created. Immutable record of when event occurred.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which action was performed (if applicable). Security tracking for moderator actions.

models.name: discussion_board_security_logs
models.description: Comprehensive security event logs capturing all security-relevant activities including authentication attempts, permission changes, suspicious activities, and security incidents. These immutable logs form the foundation of security auditing and forensic investigation capabilities. Tracks event type, actor, target resource, severity level, and full context for each security event.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: The user who triggered the security event, if applicable. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Type of security event: LOGIN_ATTEMPT, LOGIN_SUCCESS, LOGIN_FAILURE, PASSWORD_CHANGE, PASSWORD_RESET, ACCOUNT_LOCKOUT, PERMISSION_GRANT, PERMISSION_REVOKE, ROLE_CHANGE, CONTENT_ACCESS, CONTENT_REMOVE, USER_WARN, USER_SUSPEND, USER_BAN, ANOMALY_DETECTED, BRUTE_FORCE_ATTEMPT, TOKEN_REFRESH, SESSION_CREATE, SESSION_TERMINATE, MFA_ENABLE, MFA_DISABLE, CERTIFICATE_UPDATED, API_KEY_ROTATED, DATA_BREACH_DETECTED, SUSPICIOUS_ACTIVITY.

plainFields.name: severity_level
plainFields.description: Severity classification: CRITICAL (immediate action required), HIGH (urgent attention needed), MEDIUM (investigation recommended), LOW (informational). Guides incident response prioritization.

plainFields.name: event_description
plainFields.description: Detailed human-readable description of the security event explaining what occurred and why it matters. Up to 1000 characters providing full context for investigators.

plainFields.name: actor_type
plainFields.description: Type of actor performing action: USER (authenticated user), SYSTEM (automated system process), ADMINISTRATOR (admin override), UNAUTHENTICATED (guest or failed auth), EXTERNAL_SERVICE (integration failure).

plainFields.name: actor_ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which the security event originated. Null for system-generated events. Used for geographic analysis and pattern detection.

plainFields.name: actor_user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser/client user agent string from the request. Helps identify device type, browser version, and operating system. Null for non-HTTP events.

plainFields.name: target_resource_type
plainFields.description: Type of resource being accessed or modified: USER_ACCOUNT, USER_PROFILE, DISCUSSION, COMMENT, PERMISSION, ROLE, CONTENT, DATABASE, SYSTEM_CONFIG, CREDENTIAL, SESSION, TOKEN.

plainFields.name: target_resource_id
plainFields.description: UUID of the specific resource being accessed or modified. Null if event doesn't target specific resource (e.g., system-wide configuration change).

plainFields.name: action_result
plainFields.description: Result of the security event: SUCCESS, FAILURE, BLOCKED, PENDING_REVIEW, ERROR. Indicates whether the event succeeded or was intercepted by security controls.

plainFields.name: additional_metadata
plainFields.description: JSON-formatted additional context data relevant to the security event. May include before/after values, query parameters, error codes, suspicious patterns detected, or forensic details. Stored as JSON string for flexibility.

plainFields.name: geolocation_country
plainFields.description: Country of origin derived from IP address geolocation. Used for anomaly detection (impossible travel patterns, unusual geographic access).

plainFields.name: geolocation_city
plainFields.description: City of origin derived from IP address geolocation. Used for anomaly detection and geographic analysis of security events.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when security event occurred, recorded at server in UTC. Precise to millisecond for sequencing and incident reconstruction.

plainFields.name: retained_until
plainFields.description: Date after which this security log may be deleted per retention policy. Calculated based on event severity and regulatory requirements (typically 1-3 years). Alerts admins before expiration.

models.name: discussion_board_audit_logs
models.description: Detailed audit trail for all system modifications and administrative actions including content changes, user management, moderation decisions, and system configuration updates. Maintains immutable record of who changed what, when, and why. Supports compliance requirements (GDPR, audit trails) and facilitates forensic investigation of system state changes. Captures before/after values for complete change tracking.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: The user who performed the action being audited. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}. Null for system-generated actions.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Category of action being audited: CREATE (new resource created), UPDATE (resource modified), DELETE (resource removed), RESTORE (deleted resource recovered), APPROVE (content/action approved), REJECT (content/action rejected), EXPORT (data exported), IMPORT (data imported), CONFIGURATION (system config changed), PERMISSION (permissions modified).

plainFields.name: entity_type
plainFields.description: Type of entity affected by action: USER, DISCUSSION, COMMENT, CATEGORY, CONTENT_FLAG, MODERATION_ACTION, USER_WARNING, SUSPENSION, BAN, APPEAL, ROLE, PERMISSION, CONFIGURATION, SYSTEM_SETTING, GUIDELINE.

plainFields.name: entity_id
plainFields.description: UUID of the specific entity being modified. Null for system-wide actions not tied to specific resource.

plainFields.name: before_value
plainFields.description: Complete state/value of entity before the change (JSON-formatted for complex objects). Null for CREATE actions. Maximum 5000 characters, truncated if necessary. Enables comparison and rollback analysis.

plainFields.name: after_value
plainFields.description: Complete state/value of entity after the change (JSON-formatted for complex objects). Null for DELETE actions unless entity was restored. Enables change verification and compliance reporting.

plainFields.name: change_reason
plainFields.description: Explanation or justification for the action. May be policy violation explanation, appeal decision, or administrative reason. Maximum 500 characters. Required for sensitive actions (bans, data deletion).

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which action was performed. Null for system-generated actions. Used for geographic audit trail and anomaly detection.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser/client user agent string. Helps identify device and browser used for action. Null for non-HTTP actions.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Status of the audited action: COMPLETED (action finished successfully), PENDING (awaiting processing), FAILED (action failed to complete), REJECTED (action was blocked by controls). Used for tracking action outcomes.

plainFields.name: risk_assessment
plainFields.description: Security/compliance risk classification for this action: LOW (routine action), MEDIUM (requires review), HIGH (sensitive action), CRITICAL (high-impact action). Guides incident investigation prioritization.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when action occurred, recorded at server in UTC. Essential for sequential reconstruction of events and compliance reporting.

plainFields.name: retention_expires_at
plainFields.description: Date after which this audit log may be deleted per data retention policy. Typically 2-3 years depending on regulatory requirements. System alerts administrators before expiration.

models.name: discussion_board_login_attempts
models.description: Tracks all authentication attempts (successful and failed) for security monitoring and brute force detection. Records login history with IP addresses, geolocation, device information, and results. Used to detect account takeover attempts, impossible travel patterns, and suspicious access patterns. Supports account lockout policies and fraud prevention mechanisms. Maintains complete audit trail of who accessed what accounts from where.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: The user account targeted by the login attempt. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}. Null if attempt used invalid email (user not found).

plainFields.name: email_attempted
plainFields.description: Email address used in login attempt. Captures what email user tried (may be typo, invalid, or compromised). Used for detecting brute force against specific accounts or email enumeration attacks.

plainFields.name: attempt_result
plainFields.description: Outcome of login attempt: SUCCESS (credentials valid, user logged in), FAILURE_INVALID_CREDENTIALS (wrong password), FAILURE_USER_NOT_FOUND (email not registered), FAILURE_ACCOUNT_LOCKED (too many recent failed attempts), FAILURE_ACCOUNT_DISABLED (user suspended/banned), FAILURE_EMAIL_UNVERIFIED (email not yet verified).

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which login attempt originated. Essential for geographic anomaly detection, impossible travel patterns, and brute force source identification. Null if captured from proxy/VPN.

plainFields.name: geolocation_country
plainFields.description: Country derived from IP geolocation. Used for detecting impossible travel (e.g., New York then Tokyo in 10 minutes) and unusual geographic patterns.

plainFields.name: geolocation_city
plainFields.description: City derived from IP geolocation. Provides geographic context for access pattern analysis and anomaly detection.

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser/client user agent string from HTTP request. Used to identify device type, browser, OS, and detect logins from unexpected devices (e.g., previously used Android phone, now using Windows).

plainFields.name: device_fingerprint
plainFields.description: Hash of device characteristics (browser type, OS, screen resolution, plugins, etc.). Helps identify logins from new devices or spoofed devices. Null for non-HTTP logins.

plainFields.name: failed_attempt_count
plainFields.description: Cumulative count of failed login attempts from this IP address in the past 15 minutes. Used to trigger account lockout policies and rate limiting. Reset when successful login occurs.

plainFields.name: is_suspicious
plainFields.description: Flag indicating if login attempt triggered anomaly detection. True if: impossible travel, new device, unusual time, multiple geographic logins simultaneously, etc. Guides manual investigation.

plainFields.name: anomaly_reason
plainFields.description: If is_suspicious is true, explains why anomaly detected: IMPOSSIBLE_TRAVEL, NEW_DEVICE, UNUSUAL_TIME, CONCURRENT_SESSIONS, HIGH_RISK_COUNTRY, BRUTE_FORCE_PATTERN, etc.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when login attempt occurred, recorded at server in UTC. Millisecond precision for sequencing of rapid attempts and detecting bursts.

models.name: discussion_board_permission_changes
models.description: Audit trail for all permission and role modifications in the system. Tracks every grant, revoke, or modification of user permissions, role assignments, and administrative privileges. Records who made the change, what changed, from what to what, when, and why. Critical for compliance (GDPR, SOC 2, audit requirements), privilege escalation detection, and understanding current permission state at any point in time. Enables rollback analysis and permission history queries.

foreignFields.name: discussion_board_user_id
foreignFields.description: The user whose permissions were modified. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}.

foreignFields.name: modified_by_user_id
foreignFields.description: The administrator or system user who made the permission change. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}. Null for system-generated permission changes.

plainFields.name: change_type
plainFields.description: Type of permission change: ROLE_GRANT (user assigned to role), ROLE_REVOKE (user removed from role), PERMISSION_GRANT (specific permission granted), PERMISSION_REVOKE (specific permission removed), CATEGORY_ASSIGNMENT (moderator assigned to category), CATEGORY_REMOVAL (moderator removed from category).

plainFields.name: role_before
plainFields.description: User's role before the change (GUEST, MEMBER, MODERATOR, ADMINISTRATOR). Null for permission-level changes that don't affect role.

plainFields.name: role_after
plainFields.description: User's role after the change. Null if user role didn't change (only specific permissions modified).

plainFields.name: permission_name
plainFields.description: Name of specific permission being granted/revoked, if applicable. Examples: CREATE_DISCUSSION, POST_COMMENT, VOTE, MODERATE_CONTENT, MANAGE_USERS, SYSTEM_ADMIN. Null for role-level changes.

plainFields.name: resource_type
plainFields.description: Type of resource permission applies to: GLOBAL (system-wide), CATEGORY (specific discussion category), USER (specific user management). Used for scoped permissions.

plainFields.name: resource_id
plainFields.description: UUID of specific resource (e.g., category_id for category-scoped moderators). Null for system-wide permissions.

plainFields.name: change_reason
plainFields.description: Explanation for why permission was changed: PROMOTION (user earned moderator status), VIOLATION (permissions revoked due to violations), PROBATION (temporary restrictions), ADMINISTRATIVE (admin override), ROLE_CHANGE (automatic from role change).

plainFields.name: approval_required
plainFields.description: Whether this permission change required approval (e.g., promoting to administrator). Tracks if approval was obtained and when.

plainFields.name: approval_by_user_id
plainFields.description: If approval was required, ID of approver (typically more senior admin). Null if not required or not yet approved.

plainFields.name: effective_from
plainFields.description: Date/time when permission change became effective. May be future-dated for scheduled permission changes. Null means immediately effective.

plainFields.name: expires_at
plainFields.description: Date/time when temporary permission expires (e.g., temporary moderation probation). Null for permanent permission changes. System automatically revokes on expiration.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address of administrator who made the change. Null for system-generated changes. Used for anomaly detection (admin accessing from unusual location).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when permission change was recorded, in UTC. Enables chronological reconstruction of permission history.

models.name: discussion_board_data_access_logs
models.description: Tracks all access to sensitive user data by administrators and system processes. Records who accessed what personal information, when, from where, and why. Critical for privacy compliance (GDPR right of access, audit requirements) and detecting unauthorized data access or insider threats. Monitors administrator access to user emails, profile data, activity history, and other PII. Enables detection of data theft or privacy violations by insiders.

foreignFields.name: accessing_user_id
foreignFields.description: The administrator or system user accessing the sensitive data. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}. Null for automated system access.

foreignFields.name: subject_user_id
foreignFields.description: The user whose data is being accessed. References {@link discussion_board_users.id}. Null if accessing system-level data not tied to specific user.

plainFields.name: access_type
plainFields.description: Nature of data access: VIEW (read-only access to data), EXPORT (data exported/downloaded), MODIFY (data changed), DELETE (data deleted), RESTORE (deleted data recovered). Indicates what action was performed on sensitive data.

plainFields.name: data_category
plainFields.description: Category of sensitive data accessed: EMAIL_ADDRESS (user's email), PASSWORD_HASH (login credentials), IP_HISTORY (login IPs and locations), PROFILE_DATA (personal profile info), ACTIVITY_LOG (user's post/comment history), DISCUSSION_CONTENT (user's discussions and comments), VOTING_HISTORY (user's votes), SETTINGS (user preferences and config).

plainFields.name: data_description
plainFields.description: Specific data elements accessed: which fields from user profile, which discussions viewed, which settings accessed, etc. Maximum 500 characters. Used to precisely track what information was accessed.

plainFields.name: reason_for_access
plainFields.description: Stated reason for accessing sensitive data: CUSTOMER_SUPPORT (helping user), INVESTIGATION (security investigation), COMPLIANCE (regulatory requirement), ABUSE_PREVENTION (blocking spam), INCIDENT_RESPONSE (responding to security incident), ADMINISTRATIVE (routine admin task).

plainFields.name: approval_status
plainFields.description: Whether this access was approved: APPROVED (authorized), PENDING_APPROVAL (requested but not yet approved), DENIED (request denied), EMERGENCY (accessed under emergency conditions).

plainFields.name: data_volume
plainFields.description: Approximate volume of sensitive data accessed: number of records viewed, size of export in bytes, count of items. Helps detect unusual bulk access patterns.

plainFields.name: ip_address
plainFields.description: IP address from which sensitive data was accessed. Null for system-generated access. Used for anomaly detection (admin accessing from unusual location).

plainFields.name: user_agent
plainFields.description: Browser/client information used to access sensitive data. Helps identify expected vs. unexpected access methods (e.g., script vs. web browser).

plainFields.name: is_flagged
plainFields.description: Whether access was flagged for unusual patterns: bulk export of PII, after-hours access, access from high-risk country, authorized user accessing unusual data categories, etc. Triggers review.

plainFields.name: flag_reason
plainFields.description: If is_flagged is true, reason flagged: BULK_EXPORT, UNUSUAL_CATEGORY, AFTER_HOURS, UNAUTHORIZED_USER, MULTIPLE_USERS, HIGH_VOLUME, SUSPICIOUS_PATTERN.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when sensitive data access occurred, recorded in UTC. Critical for detecting insider threats, data theft, and establishing timeline of privacy violations.
